text.section: In this section, "bond" means an obligation of the State or of any of its units or instrumentalities.

If a bond otherwise complies with the requirements of the Commercial Law Article for investment securities, the bond shall be considered to be an investment security notwithstanding that:
the resolution or other authority under which the bond is issued subjects the bond to an indenture or agreement that is separate from the resolution or authority;
the resolution or other authority under which the bond is issued limits payment of principal and interest to:
the proceeds of limited sources of revenue; or
a special fund established for that purpose;
any law limits payment of principal and interest to a certain amount or rate of tax that may be imposed; or
principal or interest are registrable.

A bond that is considered to be an investment security under subsection (b) of this section has all the attributes of an investment security that are possessed by a bond that is:
issued on the full faith and credit of the issuer;
payable to bearer; and
secured as to the payment of principal and interest by the unlimited taxing power of the issuer.
